content: If you want to flawlessly exchange small numbers of small files between Android devices, this app is great. However, professional users will want to sync large amounts of files, or larger files between multiple computers and phones with multiple users. This is where Drive misses the mark, often badly, compared to the competition. The Windows app is particularly bad: seeing up multiple accounts is clunky and syncing is often extremely slow.
replyContent: Hi, Rik. Thanks for the feedback. You can also send it here: Google Drive app > Menu > Help & feedback > Send feedback.

content: For over a year now, there's been no option to empty your trash. There used to be; now there isn't. content: Good app.   HOWEVER, there is something wrong with the "available offline" feature. I need many files available offline (like 3 GB). Not all files remain marked "available offline": when I open a folder where files should have been available offline, they are not, even though they had been downloaded and displayed as "available offline" before. This "bug" wasn't present some two months ago.

I've had bad backup experiences so I dont depend on this one. Your solution to a lot of reviewers complaints is to try using a different network. I dont know how it is for most people but I dont have access to one. More importantly - No one should have to find a different network! YOU should 'Develope' a fix! For people who have the problem of it not recognizing their new device, make a connection step. Make an access key. Something! New phones or factory resets are common events.

Downloaded this to save 300 photos from an old phone w/issues. Weeks later, it's transferred only one, despite jamming the phone 24/7 & moving documents I didn't want. I've had to force stop the app a few times when the phone was severely overheated. *Note: conventional file tranfer methods (SD card, USB, Bluetooth, etc) haven't worked either, so I've added 2 additional stars out of recognition that it may not be entirely the app's fault.

It works for storage, but not for interactive usage of video or audio files.  If you are using it to store videos or audio, and you want to watch your videos or listen to your music directly from Google Drive it's not a good application for that.  It may work sometimes, but not all the time, as I found out.  Google tech support recommended that I store my videos on YouTube as private videos so that I can watch them whenever I wish.  But be aware that YouTube may change your uploaded video's codec and compression, meaning that the quality of your original video might be lost forever.  So I am uploading all of my videos to Google Drive to store them in their original format and quality, and then also uploading all of the videos to YouTube so that I can watch them from a storage location.  It's taking up double the storage space on Google servers since the videos are saved on both Google Drive and YouTube, but I guess that's not my problem.  If you are using it for Microsoft Document storage and want to edit you documents without downloading them to your computer, then Google Drive works okay for that.
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, Matthew. You may submit your suggestions for improvement here: http://drive.google.com > help ('?' icon) > Send feedback. This is the best way to get this feedback with our product team. Appreciate it!

content: You cannot copy and past to another folder on Android Devices anymore! It used to be simple to Copy and Share a file but now you can only send an e-mail. This was the old process: Open the Google Drive app on your Android. Tap and hold a file. Tap and select all the files you want to copy.
